meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irreconcilable.
meanings.sent1: The irreconcilability of their opinions led to constant arguments.
meanings.sent2: The irreconcilability between their beliefs made it hard to find common ground.
meanings.sent3: The irreconcilability of the two stubborn siblings often resulted in amusing debates.
meanings.sent4: The irreconcilability of their perspectives created a wall that could not be breached.
meanings.sent5: The irreconcilability of their positions was as clear as day, impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: The inability to reconcile or make compatible.
meanings.sent1: Their irreconcilability on the matter prevented any compromise.
meanings.sent2: The irreconcilability of their schedules made it challenging to meet up.
meanings.sent3: The irreconcilability of their tastes in music often led to amusing debates.
meanings.sent4: The irreconcilability of their goals created a divide that could not be bridged.
meanings.sent5: The irreconcilability of their demands was so stark, it was impossible to find a middle ground.
